title: Air Fryer Shish Taouk Tofu
description: A high-protein, crispy-edged tofu version of shish taouk using a yogurt-garlic marinade and air fryer for maximum browning.
ingredients: 1 block (454 g) extra-firm tofu, frozen then thawed
instructions: Freeze the tofu in its package overnight, then thaw fully in the fridge or in warm water.
Remove tofu from the package and press for 20–30 minutes to remove excess water.
Cut tofu into large 1.25–1.5 inch cubes (or rip into chunks if not skewering).
In a bowl, whisk Greek yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, paprika, cumin, oregano, salt, pepper, and cornstarch.
Add tofu cubes and gently fold to coat without breaking them.
Cover and refrigerate 8–24 hours for maximum flavor absorption.
Arrange tofu in a single layer in the air fryer basket. Avoid overcrowding.
Air fry for 10–12 minutes, shaking or flipping halfway, until golden with crispy edges.
notes: Tofu browns best when spaced out. If you want a stronger char, spray lightly with olive oil before air frying. Serve with toum, chickpea-cucumber salad, or barley pilaf.
